algorithm_technique: If k=1, simulate all possible rotations and find the lexicographically smallest. If k>1, any character can be moved to any position, so sorting the string yields the smallest result.
problem_summary_simple: Find the lexicographically smallest string by moving the first k characters to the end any number of times.
problem_summary_technical: If k=1, explore all rotations. If k>1, any permutation is achievable, so sort the string.
key_insights: The key distinction is the value of k.
When k > 1, the ability to move any of the first k characters allows for any permutation of the string.
When k = 1, only cyclic shifts are possible, requiring brute-force checking of all rotations.
